If you enter prime number (or 1) result would be negative Crypto Lookisha /> © 2023 Lookisha /> lookisha.main@gmail.com VIDEO Font size Backgrounds LANGUAGE Croatian English HELP Author: Lookisha

NOTE: the application uses its own implementation of different cryptographic concepts, therefore there may be differences in the original method Change Language
Caesar cipher, also known as Caesar's code is the simplest and most widely known encryption method.

It's a substitution cipher in which each letter in the plaintext is replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet.


 RANK: E Enigma (machine) is a cipher (device) used during WW2. Enigma was considered so secure that it was used to encipher the most top-secret messages.

It's a complex encryption method that uses three rotors, the main feature of the Enigma.


 RANK: A RSA (Rivest–Shamir–Adleman) is a public-key cryptosystem that is widely used for secure data transmission.

The security of RSA relies on the practical difficulty of factoring the product of two large prime numbers


 RANK: S A substitution cipher is a method of encrypting in which units of plaintext are replaced with the ciphertext. It's easily breakable using frequency analysis.

RANK: D The Vigenère cipher is a method of encrypting alphabetic text by using a series of interwoven Caesar ciphers, based on the letters of a keyword.

The cipher is easy to understand and implement, but it resisted all attempts to break it until 1863

RANK: B For example:

Key: ABCDABCDABCDABCDABCDABCDABCD
Plaintext: cryptoisshortforcryptography
Ciphertext: CSASTPKVSIQUTGQUCSASTPIUAQJB In cryptanalysis, frequency analysis (also known as counting letters) is the study of the frequency of letters or groups of letters in a ciphertext.

The method is used as an aid to breaking classical ciphers.


For a successful analysis, it is necessary to find the distribution of letters in the observed language (check it on the Internet). Classical brute force method to factorize public key N used in RSA encryption method. Don't expect the app to factor large numbers. Deciphering Method Key length / bits Time / relative RSA decryption time by key length
